full_summary:
Title: Parking Lot Upgrades - Happy Valley-Goose Bay
=====================================================

Tender Number: F6879-227001/A
--------------------------------------------

**Notice to Bidders**

This is a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the purpose of Procurement of Parking Lot Upgrades in Happy Valley-Goose Bay, Newfoundland and Labrador. The project involves the furnishing of all necessary plant, labor, equipment, and materials for the improvements to the parking lot.

**Project Overview**

The proposed project includes various components such as:

* Removal of existing grass, sand, and other materials
* Supply and installation of new Type I granular material
* Supply and placement of concrete for new parking lot
* Electrical, lighting, and heating plug installations
* Supply and installation of new wooden posts and guide rails
* Field and lab quality control testing of materials
* Submission of site-specific safety plan, environmental protection plan, and staging and work plan

**Importance of Site Familiarization**

It is recommended that bidders visit the site and its surroundings prior to submitting a proposal to review and verify the form, nature, and extent of the work, materials needed, and other relevant factors.

**Submission Requirements**

* Bids must be submitted electronically through the Canada Buys platform using the solicitation number F6879-227001/A
* All amendments issued prior to closing will be available on the Canada Buys platform and must be addressed in the submitted bid
* Suppliers are responsible for ensuring all amendments are obtained and included in the bid
* Bids can be submitted in either English or French

**Evaluation Criteria**

The lowest price will be used as the sole evaluation criterion. 

**Contact Information**

For inquiries, please contact Alexandria Dwyer at (709) 330-6330 or Alexandria.Dwyer@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca.

**Timeline**

* The estimated value of this opportunity is in the range of $100,000 and below.
* The deliverable date is approximately 8 weeks after the contract award.
* The contract will be awarded to the lowest bidder.
* The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

**Terms and Conditions**

The standard terms and conditions for this procurement are incorporated by reference into the bid and contract documents. These can be viewed at https://buyandsell.gc.ca/policy-and-guidelines/standard-acquisition-clauses-and-conditions-manual/all.
